result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DA Fox appears for the State.  No other appearances.  This was consolidated into Trempealeau County case 16CF17.  DA Fox moves to dimiss as it is completed.  Motion granted to dismiss 15CF147 and 15TR2988 case.
Copy of JOC from Trempealeau County Case No. 16CF17.
Status conference on June 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant's atty, Atty Larimore, called request Plea/Sentencing Hrg for today be taken off the calendar. I confirm that it had been ok'd with D.A.'s office (Arin). Has a charge in Trempealeau County now, and will be consolidating cases and defendant is planning on attending treatment court in Trempealeau County where he resides. Atty Larimore requested set for Status Conference on April 11th.
Status conference on April 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-07-2016 01:30 pm
Information filed with the court.  Waive reading of the information.  NGP entered by defense.  NGP entered the same.  Set for plea/sentencing.  Track traffic citations.

Court questioned the defendant on his understanding of the waiver of his preliminary hearing.  Defendant stated he understood the waiver.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to a preliminary hearing.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Larimore.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney  Larimore.  Reading of complaint waived.  PTC & STC dates set.
Adjourned initial appearance at 10-12-2015 09:30 am
Received letter from Attorney of Record, Joel Larimore, to reschedule Initial Appearance for Mr Halverson due to a schedule conflict.  Judge and DA approve.  Rescheduled for 10/12/15 @ 9:30AM.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail. Court recited the charges and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  Defendant will hire his own attorney.  Bond set.  AIA set for 9/21/15 at 9:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 09-21-2015 09:30 am

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.
